channel.title: Cache Problems Pleasssee help!(PI 317)
channel.description:
Well first off ima post the 3 things that could make this happen
Client.java - http://pastebin.com/LSgA2VPR
CacheDownloader.java - http://pastebin.com/XtStaQJ6
SignLink.java - http://pastebin.com/vL5bjGqa
Well my problem is that when the cachedownloader downloads the cache it puts in my c:/users/User and the cache is read in the USERS area But i figured out that the models are read if i put my cache in the C:/ and they dont read in the USER so i basically have 2 caches i have to keep up with Please read over those and help me out PLEASE IM DESPRATE RIGHT ABOUT NOW.

item.title: Cache Problems Pleasssee help!(PI 317)
item.dc:creator: @ewewew35 ewewew35
item.description:
@ewewew35 wrote:

142.
public static String findcachedir()

143.
        {

144.
                boolean exists = (new File(System.getProperty("user.home") + "/NearHonor Cache/")).exists();

145.
                if (exists) {

146.
                        System.out.println("Loading Client!");

147.
                        return System.getProperty("user.home") + "/NearHonor Cache/";

148.
                } else {

149.
                        File f = new File(System.getProperty("user.home") + "/NearHonor Cache/");

150.
                        f.mkdir();

151.
                        System.out.println("The Cache Has Not Downloaded, Downloading Cache!");

152.
                        return System.getProperty("user.home") + "/NearHonor Cache/";

153.
                }

154.
        }

that’s in signlink.java, change the (“user.home”) to the C:/ drive.

Well my problem is that when the cachedownloader downloads the cache it puts in my c:/users/User and the cache is read in the USERS area But i figured out that the models are read if i put my cache in the C:/ and they dont read in the USER so i basically have 2 caches i have to keep up with Please read over those and help me out PLEASE IM DESPRATE RIGHT ABOUT NOW.
